text.title: Makrinitsa
text.head: Makrinitsa
text.p:
Makrinitsa
( Greek : Μακρινίτσα ) , called the ' balcony ' of Mt .
Pelion
,
Magnesia
,
Greece
, for it 's amazing views .

Located only birth-flight , or by winding mountain road , north-east of
Volos
it is one of the most easily accessed of Pelions 24 villages .
text.head: Understand
text.p:
One of the most characteristic traditional settlements on mount Pelion . It is filled with mansions and houses from the
Ottoman era
that look like hanging ornaments on the green mountain side and are colorful ( but not as
Portaria
) . Many of these have been restored into restaurants and guesthouses . It sits on a slope of the Pelion range and another mountaintop to the east with forests , at a height of about above sea level . The square with age-old trees lends a panoramic view of Volos and the Pagasetic Gulf . In one of the traditional coffee houses there is a big fresco by the 20th century naïve folkloristic artist
Theofilos
. The picturesque cobbled paths of Makrinitsa are scattered with traditional water fountains . Makrynitsa , with a population of about 900 people , has a school , a lyceum , a church , a post office and a square ( plateia ) with tall trees .

Orientation in Makrinitsa is made more difficult by the fact that village streets are not named . Every place has got the address " Makrinitsa 370 11 " . Fortunately Makrinitsa is not very large , and you can easily orient yourself by the pedestrian main street , on which you will find the town square and the village church .
text.head: Get in
text.p:
By bus from
Volos
Interurban Bus Terminal ( " Yperastiko KTEL " ) (
KTEL Volou
) , Details on buses ,
can be found online here
A taxi from Volos city centre will cost approximately € 20 , although do ask before you get in .

There is some parking in the village , in the main carpark at the foot of the village and on the approach roads . It does get very busy in the carpark , and the approach roads are on a fairly steep gradient . Park with your front wheels turned to point into the kerb and either in park or in first gear !
text.head: Do

list.item:
Pelion Museum of Folklore and History
( Signposted from the main square . ) . Saturday 11:00 - 14:30 , Sunday 11:00 - 14:30 . Adults € 2 , children free , groups € 1 pp.

text.head: Buy
text.p: There is a main street lined with shops leading from the carpark to the main square . These shops sell all kinds of touristy trinkets , as well as jarred fruits in syrup , local herbs and pasta .
text.head: Eat

list.item:
To Kentrikon
( Κέντρικο ) , Main square . Good food , much of which is from local recipes . The highlight is the fantastic view from the tables on the square . 7-9€ for a large dish .

Cardamom Oinomageireio
( Καρδαμο Οινομαγειρειον ) , ☏ +302428090131 . A cosy restaurant with a large outdoors seating area .

text.head: Drink
text.p: The tap water is drinkable and restaurants will serve glasses of ice water upon request . Local drinks include Mythos ( beer ) and Ouzo .

list.item:
Art Cafe
, ☏ +306974384488 . A café and bar . As anywhere else in Makrinitsa , it has a large outdoor seating which offer a great view of Volos . Indoors you will find a welcoming fire and a large number of paintings by local artists .

text.head: Sleep

list.item:
Archontika Karamarlis Boutique Hotel & Guesthouse
( Has got a main entrance towards the car road climbing mount Pelion and a back-entrance towards the village main street ) , ☏ +302428099570 . An old mansion turned hotel with a breakfast buffet and a great view of Volos . They often host larger celebrations such as weddings .
